solution_line_template: Margaret finished all of her laps in {margaret_total_minutes} minutes * {seconds_per_minute} seconds = <<{margaret_total_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute}={margaret_total_seconds}>>{margaret_total_seconds} seconds.

Billy's first 5 laps took {billy_first_5_laps_minutes} minutes * {seconds_per_minute} seconds = <<{billy_first_5_laps_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute}={billy_first_5_laps_seconds}>>{billy_first_5_laps_seconds} seconds.

His next 3 laps took {billy_next_3_laps_minutes} minutes * {seconds_per_minute} seconds = <<{billy_next_3_laps_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute}={billy_next_3_laps_seconds}>>{billy_next_3_laps_seconds} seconds.
His ninth lap took {billy_ninth_lap_minutes} minute * {seconds_per_minute} seconds = <<{billy_ninth_lap_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute}={billy_ninth_lap_seconds}>>{billy_ninth_lap_seconds} seconds.

So his first 9 laps took {billy_first_5_laps_seconds} + {billy_next_3_laps_seconds} + {billy_ninth_lap_seconds} = <<{billy_first_5_laps_seconds}+{billy_next_3_laps_seconds}+{billy_ninth_lap_seconds}={billy_first_9_laps_total_seconds}>>{billy_first_9_laps_total_seconds} seconds.

Billy finished swimming his laps before Margaret so all of his laps took a total of {margaret_total_seconds} - {billy_wins_by_seconds} = <<{margaret_total_seconds}-{billy_wins_by_seconds}={billy_total_time_seconds}>>{billy_total_time_seconds} seconds.

This means that it took {billy_total_time_seconds} seconds in total swimming time - {billy_first_9_laps_total_seconds} seconds in time spent swimming the first 9 laps = {billy_final_lap_time_seconds} seconds for Billy to swim his final lap.
